alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:17PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong outflow boundary will impact portions of west central Otero and east central Dona Ana Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 516 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong outflow along a line extending from near Holloman Air Force Base to 9 miles southwest of White Sands National Monument. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orogrande, White Sands National Monument, Alamogordo, Holloman Air Force Base, Boles Acres and Oliver Lee State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 182 and 210. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 24 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
